gospel.text:
[[Mc 6,7]]Jesus summoned the Twelve and began to send them out two by two and gave them authority over unclean spirits.
[[Mc 6,8]]He instructed them to take nothing for the journey but a walking stick--no food, no sack, no money in their belts.
[[Mc 6,9]]They were, however, to wear sandals but not a second tunic.
[[Mc 6,10]]He said to them, "Wherever you enter a house, stay there until you leave from there.
[[Mc 6,11]]Whatever place does not welcome you or listen to you, leave there and shake the dust off your feet in testimony against them."
[[Mc 6,12]]So they went off and preached repentance.
[[Mc 6,13]]They drove out many demons, and they anointed with oil many who were sick and cured them.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark

first_reading.text:
[[He 12,18]]Brothers and sisters: You have not approached that which could be touched and a blazing fire and gloomy darkness and storm
[[He 12,19]]and a trumpet blast and a voice speaking words such that those who heard begged that no message be further addressed to them,
[[He 12,21]]Indeed, so fearful was the spectacle that Moses said, "I am terrified and trembling."
[[He 12,22]]No, you have approached Mount Zion and the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and countless angels in festal gathering,
[[He 12,23]]and the assembly of the firstborn enrolled in heaven, and God the judge of all, and the spirits of the just made perfect,
[[He 12,24]]and Jesus, the mediator of a new covenant, and the sprinkled blood that speaks more eloquently than that of Abel.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Hebrews

psalm.text:
[[Ps 48,2]]Great is the LORD and wholly to be praised 
in the city of our God.
[[Ps 48,3a]]His holy mountain, fairest of heights,
is the joy of all the earth.

[[Ps 48,3b]]Mount Zion, “the recesses of the North,”
is the city of the great King.
[[Ps 48,4]]God is with her castles; 
renowned is he as a stronghold.

[[Ps 48,9]]As we had heard, so have we seen 
in the city of the LORD of hosts, 
In the city of our God; 
God makes it firm forever.

[[Ps 48,10]]O God, we ponder your mercy 
within your temple.
[[Ps 48,11]]As your name, O God, so also your praise 
reaches to the ends of the earth. 
Of justice your right hand is full.
psalm.title: Psalms
